headline: Rollins (ROL) Valuation in Focus After JPMorgan Highlights Growth Prospects and Recurring Revenue Strength
summary: Rollins (ROL) just grabbed Wall Street’s attention after JPMorgan initiated coverage with an "Overweight" rating, spotlighting the company’s knack for steady growth and its heavy reliance on recurring service contracts. About 80% of Rollins’ revenue comes from these contracts, which means the business keeps humming even when times get uncertain. With JPMorgan applauding Rollins’ resilience and pointing to the untapped U.S. pest control market, investors saw reason for optimism, sending shares...
